title:
Asymptotically periodic and bifurcation points in fractional difference
  maps
abstract:
The first step in investigating fractional difference maps, which do not have
periodic points except fixed points, is to find asymptotically periodic points
and bifurcation points and draw asymptotic bifurcation diagrams. Recently
derived equations that allow calculations of asymptotically periodic and
bifurcation points contain coefficients defined as slowly converging infinite
sums. In this paper we derive analytic expressions for coefficients of the
equations that allow calculations of asymptotically periodic and bifurcation
points in fractional difference maps.
